speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: God's love will set us free. And I believe... if I pray for that love... if I get down on my knees...... and allow God to enter my hardened, lonely miserable heart and change me through and through... that miracle... will come. Now, who here believes that with me? Do you? Do you?

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: Yes, sir, I believe it.

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: Do you? Well, believe, because God's love is not just some slogan. It's a promise straight to you from the Lord Almighty Himself. A promise paid for with the blood of his only begotten son, Jesus Christ of Nazareth. All you have to do... is believe.

speaker: PRISONERS
line: Amen!

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: God's love will set you free. Now, doesn't that just lift up your heart and make you want to say Glory! Amen!

speaker: PRISONERS
line: Glory! Amen!

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: Join with me. Allow the spirit of Jesus Christ to show you the way up to our Heavenly Father. Glory! Amen!

speaker: PRISONERS
line: Glory! Amen!

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: Let God's love free you from your prison and deliver you to His side in heaven. Glory! Amen!

speaker: PRISONERS
line: Glory! Amen!

speaker: REVEREND ORISON

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: Glory. Amen.

line: Then where does that leave you?

speaker: GUARD
line: Sorry. Just not good enough for the Illinois penal system.

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: My hands! My hands!

speaker: MARSHALL DADDO
line: Life without chance of parole for the premeditated and sadistic sexual murders of five Twin Cities women in 1994. Donald Addie Pfaster. You two put this man away.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Someone forgot to throw away the key.

speaker: MARSHALL DADDO
line: Ah, well, that's another story. Right now, we have to apprehend this man. We'd use all the help you can give us in understanding exactly who it is we're after.

speaker: MULDER
line: Donnie Pfaster is a death fetishist-- a collector of bone and dead flesh, of toenails and hair. It's what floats his boat, gets him off.

speaker: MARSHALL DADDO
line: He's a sick man.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sick would describe him. We found women's fingers in his freezer. He liked to eat them with his peas and carrots.

speaker: MARSHALL DADDO
line: So it's just women he's after?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just women. Been five years in here thinking about only that. I'm sure he's worked up quite an appetite.

speaker: MARSHALL DADDO
line: I happen to know you two agents have a particular forte-- a thing for... what is it called? The supernatural? Now, the circumstances of the escape...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I promise you there is nothing supernatural about this man. Donnie Pfaster is just plain evil.

line: Don't look any further Don't look any further Someone to count on In a world ever changing

line: Here I am, baby

speaker: MULDER
line: Didn't look at the file, did you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A man escaped from prison.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not a man. Donnie Pfaster. And he didn't just escape, he walked out. He walked out of a maximum security facility and no one seems to know how he did it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Isn't that why we're here?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's why I'm here. I don't know about you. Why are you here? Go home, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this case doesn't bother me.

speaker: MULDER
line: The man abducted you. Donnie Pfaster did a number on your head like I've never seen and it's okay... to walk away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that man does things to people that no one should ever have to think about. It's not a question of if I should stay. I don't have a choice. So let's get to work.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, this isn't the first incident. Two prisoners have escaped from maximum security facilities in neighboring states over the past year.

speaker: SCULLY
line: 6:06? And what's so supernatural about that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dozens of witnesses, guards, and staff, and no one seems to remember anything. For a while, they didn't even know these guys were missing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have they been apprehended?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, neither of the men have ever been seen again.

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: I already told the Warden everything I know... everything I saw that day.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, but I'm still a little confused. Maybe you could go over it again.

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: I'm a Christian man.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then I know you'll tell me the truth.

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: Yeah, but I got no idea about Donnie Pfaster....... or how he broke out.

speaker: MULDER
line: You and Donnie Pfaster were in the garment shop at or about the time he disappeared.

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: Well, it wasn't just me. I mean, there was a lot of us in the shop.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but you had something happen. You had an incident.

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: Yeah. Something like that.

speaker: MULDER
line: You cried out to the guards that you'd cut your hands.

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: My fingers, man. I saw them all cut off.

speaker: MULDER
line: Others saw them, too.

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: No, but I felt them cut off.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you explain that?

speaker: BRIGHAM

speaker: BRIGHAM
line: Glory. Amen.

speaker: BRIGHAM

speaker: MULDER

speaker: MULDER
line: Doesn't work on you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know what hypnosis is, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Group hypnosis.

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: MULDER
line: Mesmer was able to hypnotize and command entire audiences.

speaker: MULDER
line: Three inmates are missing from three separate prisons. One man has had possible contact with each of those cons. The prison chaplain. Glory. Amen. Not God, the chaplain. Scully, what?

line: You aren't a narc, are you?

speaker: DONNIE PFASTER
line: No.

line: You're looking at my hands.

speaker: DONNIE PFASTER
line: You need a buff and polish.

line: What are you? A freak?

speaker: DONNIE PFASTER
line: I... I just got out of prison.

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Hey, Missy. Leave the customers alone!

speaker: DONNIE PFASTER
line: I'll do it for free.

line: You just got out of prison and you want to give me a manicure?

speaker: DONNIE PFASTER
line: I'll even do your cuticles.

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: You receive the Lord's grace and this is your thanks?

speaker: DONNIE PFASTER
line: What?

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: Who do you think got you out of prison?

speaker: DONNIE PFASTER
line: I don't care. I'm busy right now.

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: The Grace of God got you out and it's the only thing that will keep you out.

speaker: BLUEBERRY
line: I thought you were kidding.

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: He's chosen you, Donnie.

speaker: BLUEBERRY
line: Later.

line: You called them on me.

line: No.

line: I have a car.

speaker: DONNIE PFASTER
line: We aren't going to make it to the car.

line: It's within His power.

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: Glory, amen. Glory, amen.

line: Was he here?

line: Well, um... We're trying to determine that.

line: Well, that's a good question. We thought we saw something, but apparently we didn't.

line: A prison chaplain, it turns out. A Reverend Orison. Paramedics took him to the hospital.

line: Special Agent Dana Scully.

line: Believe in the Lord, Agent Scully. He believes in you.

line: That's nice... But my partner and I are more concerned with several disappearances from maximum-security facilities that seem to involve you.

line: What do you mean? Reverend?

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: You're a Believer, aren't you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This has nothing to do with me, sir.

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: It has everything to do with you. You have faith... have had faith. You hear Him calling you but you're unsure what to do.

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: You stand as you do now, neither here nor there... longing... but afraid, waiting for a sign. But the signs are everywhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to the inmates, sir?

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: Everything has a reason, Scout. Everything on God's earth. Every moment of every day the Devil waits for but an instant. As it is, it has always been. The Devil's instant is our eternity.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Good Reverend. How do you do? Or maybe I should say, "How do you do it?"

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: His is the Word. I am but the Messenger who delivers it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, this delivery arrived a little late-- a little late and a little cold as a matter of fact. I thought you'd want to see it.

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: What is this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Blood of the lamb, Reverend. Handiwork of Mr. Donnie Pfaster-- a young girl he picked up at the bus stop.

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: Oh, Lord.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is he, Reverend?

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: He took my car. She wasn't supposed to die.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Donnie was supposed to die. You were supposed to kill him. That's why you freed him. God knows you're capable of it. The Reverend Orison is really Robert Gailen Orison-- convicted in 1959 of first degree murder. Served 22 years in Soledad.

speaker: REVEREND ORISON
line: God spoke to me. He told me to look after Donnie.

speaker: MULDER
line: When God spoke to you, Reverend, did He happen to mention where Donnie was headed?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you going, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: To prove that man's a liar.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you prove that somebody isn't being directed by God? You don't believe that it happens?

speaker: MULDER
line: God is a spectator, Scully. He just reads the box scores.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't believe that.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think God directs that man? You think He directs him to kill?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Donnie Pfaster isn't dead, and we don't know that the other inmates who escaped are dead, either.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, what? You think that God directs him to... let the prisoners out to kill?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, but I believe that the Reverend believes what he's saying-- that's it's God working through him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, plenty of nut bags do. Has he ever spoken to you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm trying not to take offense.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did he say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I have heard that song three times now. That may not mean anything to you but it means something to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does it mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I never thought about it before. It never meant anything to me until yesterday when it made me remember something.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: When I was thirteen my father was stationed in San Diego. I was listening to the radio to that song when my mother came in and told me that my Sunday School teacher had been killed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hmm...

speaker: SCULLY
line: He had been murdered in his front yard... And that's the first time that I ever felt that there was real evil in the world. Mulder, Reverend Orison called me "Scout." That's the same name that my Sunday School exactly the same time that I woke up yesterday morning when my power went out.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, what do you think that God is telling you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, all right. Come with me, Scout. I'll show you how the Reverend talks to God.

speaker: REPORTER
line: Police are involved in a four-state manhunt for a prisoner who escaped maximum security in Marion, Illinois. He was last seen driving a green 1970 Chevrolet Impala with a black landau top. He is described as six feet tall, medium build...

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a cerebral edema.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Swelling of the brain-- a trauma not uncommon with this kind of head injury or accident.

speaker: MULDER
line: Except this isn't accidental. The cause, in fact, as it was stated to me is self-inflicted. There's a small hole here in the skull which allows oxygen into the brain cavity, the result of which is the Reverend Orison has three times the normal blood volume pumping through his brain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And he did this himself?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. My guess is he-he probably did it when he first got into prison-- when he first learned how to use its powers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Its powers."

speaker: MULDER
line: There's a theory that at this point in human evolution our mental capabilities are limited only by inadequate blood supply. In fact, centuries ago, in the Peruvian Andes, Holy Men used to physically remove parts of their skulls in order to increase blood volume or drill small holes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So this hole in his head enables Reverend Orison to help these prisoners escape?

speaker: MULDER
line: The practitioners of this found that they could perform certain mental tricks one of which they called "stopping the world."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, nobody can stop the world, Mulder. I don't care how many holes they have in their head.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but maybe they can alter perception of it creating a disparate version of reality which they can then project through hypnosis.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But why? I mean, even if he could, why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Donnie Pfaster is serving a life sentence without possibility of parole. That's the final judgment as far as society is concerned but not in the eyes of God or in the eyes of a man who thinks he's God's tool.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, then, if Reverend Orison meant to kill Donnie Pfaster then why is he still alive?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. Maybe he unleashed something that he couldn't control. Maybe he thought he was opening the door of perception but then unwittingly he... opened the gates of Hell.

line: Pray for God's love, Donnie. Find the humility in yourself to allow God into your heart. All you have to do is believe. Repent. You'll feel God's love come to show you the way to His heavenly kingdom.

line: Well, you were right. I was looking too hard for connections that weren't there. Orison was a murderer, plain and simple. He liberated those prisoners so he could bring them out here and pass judgment on them.
